title: Installation
content:
Git Installation on Windows#This guide walks you through installing Git on a Windows machine.
Download Git#Visit the official Git website: https://git-scm.com Click the Download for Windows button The installer will automatically detect your system (32-bit or 64-bit) and download the appropriate version Run the Installer#Open the downloaded .exe file Click Next to proceed through the installation wizard Installation Options#Step 1: Select Components#Keep the default selections checked: ‚úì Git Bash Here ‚úì Git GUI Here ‚úì Git LFS (Large File Support) ‚úì Associate .git* configuration files with the default text editor Step 2: Choose Default Editor#Select your preferred text editor (Notepad++, VS Code, or Vim) If unsure, choose Nano as it’s beginner-friendly Step 3: Configure PATH Environment#Select Git from the command line and also from 3rd-party software This allows you to use Git in any terminal application Step 4: HTTPS Transport Backend#Select Use the native Windows Secure Channel library This uses Windows’ built-in SSL/TLS for secure connections Step 5: Line Ending Conversions#Select Checkout as-is, commit as-is (recommended for cross-platform projects) Or select Checkout Windows-style, commit Unix-style if you’re working on Windows only Step 6: Terminal Emulator#Select Use Windows’ default console window MinTTY is also a good option if you prefer a Unix-like terminal Step 7: Extra Options#Check Enable file system caching for better performance Check Enable Git Credential Manager for easier authentication Complete Installation#Click Install to start the installation Wait for the process to complete (usually takes 1-2 minutes) Click Finish Verify Installation#Open Command Prompt or PowerShell and run:
git --versionYou should see output like: git version 2.43.0.windows.1
Initial Configuration#Configure your Git identity for commits:
git config --global user.name "Your Name" git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"Verify the configuration:
git config --global --listNext Steps#Learn the basic Git commands Set up a GitHub account if you haven’t already Clone your first repository and start version control!

title: Git Installation
content:
Installing Git#Git is a distributed version control system essential for collaborative development and tracking project changes.
Windows#Download the installer from git-scm.com Run the installer and follow the setup wizard Choose default options or customize based on your preferences Open Command Prompt or PowerShell and verify: git --version macOS#Using Homebrew: brew install git Verify installation: git --version Linux#Using package manager: # Ubuntu/Debian sudo apt-get install git # Fedora sudo dnf install git Verify installation: git --version Initial Configuration#After installation, configure Git with your details:
git config --global user.name "Your Name" git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"Verify your configuration:
git config --list
